title: If the Bible is an allegory, is too Christ an allegory? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes and no. Something being allegorical doesn’t necessarily mean it’s fictional. An actual historical event can carry an allegorical meaning. God is the Supreme Author, and able to use every means to teach and guide us — including through historical events. Certainly traditional Christian teaching allows that we have an ‘inner Jesus Christ.’ Hence, it is also a traditional understanding that the events in Christ life, in addition to being historical, symbolize events and processes associated with salvation within our souls. For example, St. Paul plainly says (I think) that we must ‘crucify’ our carnal-minded nature. Similarly, Christians are supposed to seek an inner resurrection or revivification. Likely it has been suggested over the centuries that most or all of the events in Christ’s life also symbolize stages of personal advancement. When Christianity teaches as a basic doctrine the ‘imitation of Christ’ it as much as says plainly that Christs’ life is both a historical fact and an allegory.
